page.title: 05Blachford Estate,Cornwood
page.content: Blachford,mentioned in the Domesday Book,covers approx.3sq.km.of Cornwood parish.In 1985 it comprises an 18th century mansion,a trout lake,parkland, fields and open moorland,and certain shooting & fishing rights.On the 21st July 1985 it was sold by auction for Â£585,000.In Cornwood square is a granite cross in memory of Frederick Rogers,8th Baronet of Blachford (made baronet 1871) who was Under Sec.of State for the Colonies for 25 years.The family was responsible for setting up a young man's club (boarding house) in Cornwood and a similar institution for young women in Ivybridge (Dame Hannah Rogers Sch. is now a sch.for handicapped children) At one time the estate provided work for many villagers.Today much of it is in need of renovation and good management.
